infodynamics.measures.continuous

Interface EntropyCalculator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EntropyCalculatorGaussian, EntropyCalculatorKernel, EntropyCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian, EntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKernel, EntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKozachenko

    public interface EntropyCalculator
extends InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
    Interface for implementations of entropy estimators on continuous univariate data (ie double[] arrays).

    Usage of the child classes implementing this interface is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator;
    2. Set properties using InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous.setProperty(String, String);
    3. Initialise the calculator InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous.initialise();
    4. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using: setObservations(double[]);
    5. Compute the entropy using: InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous.computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
    6. Return to step 2 or 3 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.

    References:

    • T. M. Cover and J. A. Thomas, 'Elements of Information Theory' (John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1991).
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

        computeAverageLocalOfObservations, getLastAverage, getNumObservations, getProperty, initialise, setDebug, setProperty

    • Method Detail

      • setObservations

        void setObservations(double[] observations)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the samples from which to compute the PDF for the entropy. Should only be called once, the last call contains the observations that are used (they are not accumulated).
        Parameters:
        observations - array of (univariate) samples
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalOfPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the local entropy values for each of the previously-supplied samples.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations.

        Returns:
        the array of local entropy values corresponding to each previously supplied observation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
